title: To War
opening: The Imperial army, led by Edelgard, advances on Garreg Mach. As everyone struggles to process this turn of events, the grim reality of war fast approaches.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Unforgivable! I cannot believe that the Adrestian Empire would embark on such a violent course of action.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: The fault is my own. I failed to see the wickedness within Edelgard's heart.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Is she wicked?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: She plotted with ill-meaning strangers to achieve her own ambitions and defiled the Holy Tomb. If that is not wicked, what is?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What is her objective?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: There is no question on that front. She clearly wishes to conquer all of Fódlan. And in order to achieve her own selfish ambitions, she plotted with ill-meaning strangers and defiled the Holy Tomb.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Or perhaps her ambitions are even grander than we know. Perhaps she is planning to make herself a false deity by demonizing the Church of Seiros...

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Adrestia received its very name through a divine oracle. To injure the goddess is a sin most foul that shall not be forgiven nor forgotten. We must stop the Empire...and quickly.

dialogue.speaker: Shamir
dialogue.line: I have returned, Rhea.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Welcome back, Shamir. Were you able to discern the Empire's movements?

dialogue.speaker: Shamir
dialogue.line: Their main troops are marching towards Garreg Mach. It is said that they will join forces with Edelgard's army and arrive within two weeks.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Two weeks? That is not enough time! It will require all of our efforts just to prepare our defenses before then. We must send notice to all surrounding villages at once. We must order the residents of Garreg Mach to flee for their lives.

dialogue.speaker: Shamir
dialogue.line: It will be done.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: ...Professor...listen closely. If our enemy invades the monastery, I will have no choice but to stand upon the battlefield. If something happens to me...I am entrusting my sacred duties to you.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Why me?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Sacred duties?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: You must have guessed it by now. The truth of who you are. Or perhaps I should say, your lost memories are surely beginning to return. I have acted all these long years as a mere proxy for you. But the duty is yours and yours alone. Only you can lead the people of Fódlan.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: ...Rhea, please. You must tell me all that you know. I beg of you.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: That one...is the progenitor god. Am I correct?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: In a sense. Our dear professor is...a vessel. One who carries the power of the progenitor god within. In time, the vessel will become one with the power contained within, and the progenitor god shall return to this world.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I see. I trust that you are aware of the questionable nature of this experiment? But I suppose there is no turning back...

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I ask that you help our friend...and in doing so, help her. I am waiting and hoping for the moment when our creator rules this wayward land once more.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I am sorry, but I cannot do this. I am not certain it is just...

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I see. That is a shame.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I understand. As ever, I will take you at your word.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Lady Rhea! Brother! I will do my part as well!

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Flayn! Were you eavesdropping? Regardless, I am glad to hear it. You owe your life to the professor, after all. And in the end, they may prove to be our brethren.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: You have my gratitude, Seteth. And you as well, Flayn. As followers of the progenitor god, it is up to us to see our mission through.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: ... I'll have that girl's head. Just you wait...

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: The Empire is moving quickly. Edelgard must have been preparing for this for a while now. If you really think about it, she must have been planning for this even before you got the Sword of the Creator... Of course she was always a step ahead of us. We were blinded by the ball and the Battle of the Eagle and Lion, and everything else...

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Half of the Empire's six great noble families have declared their support for Edelgard. Of the other three, Lord Vestra was assassinated. Hubert, his son, will succeed him. Bernadetta's father, Count Varley, is under house arrest. His wife is now supporting Edelgard. And my father...he was stripped of his role as prime minister. As as result, House Aegir has lost all of its power, all of its land. We have lost everything. I...I... What do I do?

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: The most important nobles in the Empire are known for taking power from the previous emperor, my father included. I didn't think it possible that the Imperial princess could ascend the throne so easily. However, it seems that both my father and Caspar's are supporting Edelgard... Having both the Minister of Domestic Affairs and Minister of Military Affairs on your side gives you total control over the Empire's military and finances. They must have been making preparations for quite some time without anyone noticing...

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I don't normally have a problem jumping into a fight, but it feels strange going up against my father. We aren't especially close, but he's not an opponent I'd want to face. I'd almost rather fight a monster! I hope he's not part of the group coming to attack Garreg Mach...

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: What does war with Edelgard mean for us, Professor? And why does she even want that?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Yeah, I guess we'd have to ask her.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: She seems to think force is the only way.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: I wonder why she'd think that...

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: That's how it always goes, I guess. You never realize something can't be undone until you've done it.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Edelgard became emperor and raised an army, huh? Who knew the kid had it in her? I mean, yeah, of course, I knew she'd be emperor eventually, but... The more I think about it, the more surprised I am. I wonder who's going to win...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Us or her, you mean?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: But would it really be OK for Edelgard to win?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We will not lose.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Thinking about it makes me scared. We're up against the entire Imperial army! Still, I know someone as smart as you will figure something out...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I am owing big debts to Duke Gerth of the Empire. He is the Minister of Affairs that are Foreign. He is a friend of Edelgard. He is to her side. What should I be doing?

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have had the arrival of a letter from Edelgard. She is asking...that I join her side. She is making the decision...no, she is deciding if Brigid is a friend or an enemy of the Empire. But my choice is not to be friends. My choice is to fight with you. Brigid is not a friend of the Empire. We will not be following again. We will be ready to fight with you instead.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: His Highness calls for the head of Edelgard. For me, that is cause enough to fight.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That is against the teachings of the goddess.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Perhaps. But it is too late to stop him now.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're truly all right with that?

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: The hatred of His Highness is also my hatred. Any other feelings I may have are irrelevant.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: And if Edelgard was responsible in any way for the Tragedy of Duscur, that is something I cannot ignore. If that is the case, then she is my enemy.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: You saw it too, didn't you? The boar's true nature. He's hidden his desire for revenge pretty well. But now it's stirred up. Well, regardless. That girl's starting an all-out war, isn't she? But an enemy is an enemy, no matter who they are. Don't let compassion for her get in your way.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Once the Imperial army reaches the monastery, we'll have no choice but to fight...

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: What's going to happen to us?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Everything will be all right.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I believe you. With the knights on our side, and especially with you, Professor, I know we can do this!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I can't say for sure.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Oh. Well, we'll just have to try our best.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Things must be pretty crazy in Faerghus about now. My father must be beside himself. I don't get it. Why did Edelgard make enemies with the nobles?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I have no idea.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Me either... Of course, even if we did get it, what do we do about it?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: For the sake of her ideals?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ideals she believes in so much she was willing to start a war over them? Those must be some lofty ideals, to say the least.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I hope this all gets sorted out quickly and safely. I'm worried about my father.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I guess we have no choice but to fight, have we? Oh, but why would Edelgard do something like this? I'm sure we'll be all right though, Professor. The goddess will keep us safe.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: I've known His Highness since I was a child, but I've never seen that side of him before. He seemed like a completely different person than the one I know...

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: The Empire's aggression cannot stand. But if we are going to attack them now, we must be honest with ourselves about our chances of success. It goes without saying that I will fight the Imperial army with everything I have, for as long as I am able. But House Gloucester's territory is adjacent to Imperial lands. Let us proceed with caution.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I hear the Alliance's territory will be in danger if we don't get rid of these Empire guys! If the Alliance is in danger, that means my sister's in danger too! There's no way I'm gonna allow that. It doesn't matter how many guys they throw at us, I'll beat 'em all! These muscles aren't just for show! But first, I gotta get some food.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: You know, Professor, I'm glad that I came to the Officers Academy. I feel accepted here. I've learned so much. Honestly, I'm surprised at how much I've grown. So, I will not let the academy be destroyed. It's important to me, and I will protect it!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I feel the same.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I feel braver just hearing you say that, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't do anything rash.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I'll try to keep a clear head, but there won't be any turning back for me. I don't want to have regrets.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: We're gonna win this, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: So Edelgard, the one who calls herself the Flame Emperor, was connected to those strange beings. The Imperial army might be using even more terrifying methods than we know. You had better be cautious, Professor. Any amount of carelessness might prove to be our undoing.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Can we really defeat someone who is willing to turn their back on the world just to uphold their own beliefs? I've spent my whole life running in fear, and now...I...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can win this together.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Surely we can win if we rely on each other. Right, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can't win if you run.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: You're right. It's time to stop running. I'll fight with everything I've got!

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: You'll battle Edelgard, right? Good luck! Me? Oh, I'm going to run away. I have zero interest in dying here, thank you very much.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: At times like this, I just feel so anxious, you know? But you'll watch out for me there. Right, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: What is Edelgard even trying to achieve? She wants to destroy the church so badly that she'll take on anyone who doesn't fall in line? I don't get it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Her ideals are in conflict with yours.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's a hard thing to accept.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: I just can't believe she'd start a war over it. Not to mention using such nasty tactics to get her way. Could Captain Jeralt's death have also been a part of her plan? Don't you go and die on me, Professor. Captain Jeralt would never forgive you.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: How are you, Professor? Any new changes to report? With the Imperial army drawing near, it is most vexing that we cannot relax and converse as we once did... Thankfully, you have the divine protection of the goddess on your side. Please try to listen carefully for her voice...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I will try.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I can't hear a thing.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Please do not say such sad things. I am certain you will hear her in time.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: May the goddess's voice reach you...

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: We must protect Garreg Mach. Defiling the Holy Tomb was a sacrilege. I will not allow such a thing to happen again. The archbishop has already given you a new responsibility. I want you to rise to that honor.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Professor... War is breaking out again, is it not?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Again?

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: There was a truly terrible war, once upon a time.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I want to stop it if I can.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: An honorable notion. Do you think there is something to be done? Whatever shall we do?

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: I never wanted another war... All we can do is steel ourselves for the fight ahead.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Well, perhaps it's pointless to get upset about the past. My duty now is to prepare for battle. We're depending on your strength, Professor. Crush our enemies!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll try

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm depending on you.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Captain, I hope you're watching! We will protect Garreg Mach!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Ugh. If I could go back to last month and throttle my carefree self! Now it turns out Edelgard is the Flame Emperor, and the new Adrestian emperor! And she's striking out against the monastery, with the full force of the Imperial army behind her. We gotta beat her at her own game! For our sake as well as Lady Rhea's...

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: We're falling behind. I don't know that we can keep up with the new emperor. To think that she was able to raise an army of that size right under our noses... However hard we fight, I give us a 50 percent chance of winning. The enemy has too many advantages. We must make careful preparations.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: There are always small power struggles, still... It has been hundreds of years since all of Fódlan was consumed by war. I didn't actually think it would come to this... I feel as though I'm not in my rightful place. I cannot protect the things I should... Professor. If I survive this war, I wish to return to my homeland... To the land of my king.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: The Holy Tomb held many Crest Stones. This is the first time I've heard of Crest Stones being hidden away in such a place... But more importantly, I'm interested to know the Empire's aim. Why would their army desire Crest Stones? There is power there, yes. And yet... I must think on this. The Crest Stones lie at the heart of the events surrounding Conand Tower and the chapel as well... And of course, the Crest Stones somehow transformed those traitors and their captives into Demonic Beasts... Could that possibly be their aim?! The Empire's army may well plan to use Crest Stones to create Demonic Beasts!

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: The mastermind behind the attacks on the monastery was Edelgard? Wow. Doesn't make much sense though, does it? There would need to be all sorts of territories and groups tangled up in this sort of mess... Eh, I'm gonna stop. I don't really have the head for this political stuff. Mostly I'm worried about my old opera company. I wonder what's happening in the capital right now. I hope they're safe...

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: It's my job to protect Lady Rhea. I've gotta do it. and I gotta do it as best I can. And if that means I gotta die for her, then I will. Ugh, how could Edelgard treat Lady Rhea like she's the bad guy? She's never been anything but nice to everybody! I just don't get it at all...

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: I can't believe the Empire raised an army... Even I couldn't have guessed it. War is profitable...but dangerous. I really don't like seeing people I care about out there mixed up in all this.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings Professor! Something to report! Unexpected, isn't it? Apparently, this is the first time Garreg Mach has been invaded in its whole 995-year history! It's my job to protect this gate, so even if enemies come in droves, I will never let them through! I hope we both survive... Let's battle with all our might and pray we win this thing!

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: Listen up, everyone! The Imperial army is upon us. If you can fight, pick up a weapon! Everyone else, hurry up and evacuate! We have the goddess's protection on our side. We have nothing to fear. Victory will be ours!

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Professor. Are you ready?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Almost.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Well, hurry up. I don't need to tell you that the situation is dire. We have some support troops from the local nobles, but the army we're facing is immense. No matter how you look at it, we're at a disadvantage. To make matters worse, the enemy is being led by Edelgard. Do not underestimate how extraordinary her abilities are.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Of course we know, but we can't let her get away. Also, please cease your unwarranted glaring. We don't deserve your judgement.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: My father was removed from his role as prime minister and is still under house arrest in the Imperial capital. As his successor...it is my duty to stop her!

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: The way she's going about all of this is wrong. It's up to us to help her realize that!

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: I won't be following her, but...l won't run away either!

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Edie's going to come at us with all she's got. And that's a lot. That means we need to fight her with all of our might too.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: She is one who has strength, that has certainty. But we have strength also. We will not be losing!

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I shall fight with all that I have. It is an honor to fight alongside each of you!

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: You students really have guts, don't you? Though, I suppose I can't call you students anymore. You're now part of our order. You have our support and our gratitude. Professor, I'm counting on you. Go ahead and take the lead.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Leave it to me.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'll protect the students.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: These kids...they look up to you. I guess that goes without saying. Just look in their eyes and you can see it. If we all make it through this, let's meet again. Good luck out there!

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: They're here. At long last.

intro.speaker: Felix
intro.line: It seems this will be a battle to remember. About time.

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: I'll never give up, no matter how outnumbered we are. I'll fight to the very end!

intro.speaker: Sylvain
intro.line: Hm, I should have made a move on the Imperial princess before things got this far. It could have changed everything.

intro.speaker: Mercedes
intro.line: We have the goddess's divine protection on our side. All that's left to do is to try our best.

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: All we can do is fight as best as we can. Though...if I'm being honest, I'm really scared right now...

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: We can't just hand over the Kingdom and the monastery. We'll stop her, no matter what it takes!

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: Your Highness, you do not seem...well.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Unwell, you say? What's gotten into you? Nothing could be further from the truth. I'm so happy I can hardly contain myself. My father, my stepmother, my dear friends? They want her head. They want her life! They've whispered as much to me. And the chance to answer their pleas has arrived, at long last!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Don't lose control out there.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: I'm always in control, Professor! And I'll stay in control until I have the pleasure of killing that woman!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Don't act rashly. We're all in this together.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Of course, of course! But don't mistake my intentions. Edelgard will die by my hand, and mine alone.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Let's move, Professor. Even if it costs me my life, I won't rest until I've crushed her skull in my bare hands!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: She's back already? Talk about impatient!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: If we don't stop them, the academy will be destroyed. Prepare for battle, everyone!

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: We will stop Edelgard's rampage!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Our opponent is formidable, but if we work together, we will not fail.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Enough talking! Let's go!

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Dear Goddess… Please, protect us all…

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I shall fight with all that I have. It is an honor to fight alongside each of you!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Professor, Claude… You'll lead the way, won't you? You won't let any of us fall, right?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I wanted to talk to Rhea first, but as expected, that won't be possible. What did she hope to accomplish at the Holy Tomb? What happened to you as a baby? There are still so many things I need to know. The same goes for the real origin of the Crest Stones and the Heroes' Relics. As for Seiros and Nemesis…just how much of their mythology is true?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: It's true. But lucky for me, I refuse to die with so much still unknown. Hey, Teach… All joking aside. Can we possibly survive this battle?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We'll find a way.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: That's all we can do, right? If we gave up, the god of fate wouldn't be happy.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't know.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Hey, now! I wasn't really looking for an honest answer. Honesty is bad for morale, Teach. You'd better cut that out.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I'm a lot of things, but I'm not the kind of man to just roll over and die in a place like this. I have my own ambitions to see to. There are things…dreams…that I must see come to fruition. And I've been thinking. I want you to see those dreams realized as well. On top of all that, there are still so many secrets out there, just waiting to be uncovered. We can't let that stand, can we?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: So, Teach… No, scratch that. You're so much more. You're my ally and my friend. Teach… Friend… None of those words quite capture what you've come to mean to me. We may not be connected by blood, but I believe our bond goes deeper than that. Now that we know each other, our hearts are connected. Even if our paths diverge and we're forced to say good-bye… I know that we'll meet again.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: And so, for lack of a better word, I gratefully call you my friend, and I hold fast to the belief that this isn't it for us. No matter who or what you really are, I'll always be on your side. You can't count on much in this world, but you can count on that.

battle.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
battle.line: I have a report! The enemy is within the walls. They're about to break the defensive line!

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: The archbishop and the defensive line both require our assistance. We must protect them until reinforcements get here.

battle.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
battle.line: Report! The enemy has taken the entrances there the reinforcements were heading!

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: We must retake the strongholds to the east and west so our reinforcements can get through.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: Both strongholds secured, with time to spare.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Alright, that's one stronghold recaptured. Now, the other!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: That's both strongholds! It appears we were right on time.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: No–the monestary has fallen! We've been defeated...

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: I'm here, and I've brought reinforcements! Don't worry--we'll protect the monastery!

battle.speaker: Shamir
battle.line: I brought reinforcements. I'll send them to the front line.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: They have taken the monastery. We have lost...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We took back one of the strongholds. On to the next…

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: All right, we took back both of the strongholds. Let's keep up the momentum!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Damn it... The monastery has fallen into the hands of our enemy. We failed.

battle.speaker: Rhea
battle.line: The goddess protects us... what is there to fear rebel swords... This is blasphemy against the goddess! Stop this now!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: A wonderful chance to earn some recognition! I'll be the one to take down the monastery!

boss.speaker: Randolph
boss.line: I have no choice but to distinguish myself in this fight!

boss.speaker: Randolph
boss.line: Argh! I'm finished. I'm loathe to say it, but I must retreat...

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: Such a shame. There are people in the Empire you truly care about, too, aren't there? I wonder what will become of them.

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: What you fail to appreciate is that we have, at our backs, a force you cannot hope to defeat.

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: I can afford to fall back. We still have the advantage.

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: This fight is but a sideshow... to the ravaging of the sacred place that is Garreg Mach...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: The time is not right... I will wait for the next opportunity...

boss.speaker: Ladislava
boss.line: I will not allow you to get any closer to Her Majesty!

boss.speaker: Ladislava
boss.line: My life was changed forever by Her Majesty... Now, I lay it on the line. For the Empire!

boss.speaker: Ladislava
boss.line: Lady Edelgard, I'm so sorry! I can't keep going! I must retreat!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Think very carefully about whether you wish to raise your sword against the Empire... or if you will offer it to us in fealty. And after you've thought it through, if you still wish to fight, I won't stop you. I will simply use the full extent of my power... and crush you.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: You will come to regret raising your blade against the emperor of the Adrestian Empire!

boss.speaker: Caspar
boss.line: Huh. This guy seems real familiar...

boss.speaker: Randolph
boss.line: Y-you dastard! Aren't you... No...

boss.speaker: Caspar
boss.line: Eh, that doesn't matter right now. Let's go!

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: Lady Edelgard held you in such high esteem. In the end, however, it seems like you are nothing more than a slave to your goddess.

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: This battlefield is too chaotic... for us to kill each other upon...

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: I wish you were someone whose heart could be swayed by my words and deeds. If it were so, I would have done anything to make you my ally...

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: You're late. I... We are all tired of waiting. Now, let's separate that sick head from your neck, shall we?

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Heh. You never were one for patience.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: You fought well. But now, your fight is over. Send in our reserve troops! And give my uncle the signal!

cutscene.speaker: Rhea
cutscene.line: Everyone here, young and old, is in your hands.

cutscene.speaker: Rhea
cutscene.line: No. I will not allow another Red Canyon tragedy to happen here.

narration: In Imperial Year 1181, the New Adrestian Emperor, Edelgard von Hresvelg, led a strategic assault against the monastery at Garreg Mach. Though her own losses were great, her foes had no choice but to surrender. Archbishop Rhea commanded the Knights of Seiros, leading from the front lines against the Imperial Army. But amidst the chaos of battle, she vanished, and her whereabouts remain unknown. With this single attack, the Adrestian Empire officially launched its offensive against the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus and the Leicester Alliance. The unification of Fódlan has begun.
